column5: Emergency officials advised hundreds of residents in northwestern Ontario to evacuate their cottages Saturday as a wildfire raged out of control in the region.  The fire began at an unattended campsite across the border in Northern Minnesota several days ago......................  http://news.sympatico.msn.cbc.ca/National/...howbyline=True#
Yea, I called Kevin and he said so far we are still good to go......hope so.
Heard about this one on the radio Wayne.  I hope they put out the fire asap and no one gets hurt.
http://www.chroniclejournal.com/stories.php?id=43509  It is not contained by any means.

This will give you an idea of just how big of an area we're talking about  Don't click if you're on dial up...its 3.1meg  http://www.mnics.org/Incidents/Fire_1/perimeter_map.pdf  and the Minnesota fire fighting website  http://www.mnics.org/Incidents/fire_1.shtml  Cost to date, just for fire fighting, in USA alone $4million at this point. Does not include homes/cabins lost already.  Check out the picture gallery for some amazing pictures of the devistation.
